page.title: 06DAIRY (MILK) FARMING
page.content: High Winsley Farm is a typical farm in this area. It has about 280 cattle altogether, of which 2 are bulls, 20 dry cows, about 50 calves and 200 milking cows. To support this live stock the farm has 3 tractors, 1 muck-spreader, 1 mower, and 1 muck scraper. There are a number of buildings used, including a dairy, a mistale for calving cows, 4 barns for feed storage and bedding, and cow and calf pens in addition to a feed house. The farm is worked by 4 men, these being the Foremen, 2 general farmworkers and a relief milker. The main problem at the present time is the Milk Quotas. Farmers say these are too low, and if less imported milk was consumed the quota could be raised. Too much milk is being produced and the surplus has to be poured down the drain or cattle sold off.
